result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monte Gregory Bush

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Monte Gregory Bush appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Monte Gregory Bush.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.  
Court held a discussion with parties on if case should be resolved in Branch 17.  Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State.
Court orders case to remain in Branch 15 at this time to determine case posture. 
Court advised parties that no other status hearing requests will be granted by the Court.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Monte Gregory Bush appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Monte Gregory Bush.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case in Branch 17. Court will allow this case to be transferred to Branch 17 if Judge Stark is willing to accept jurisdiction. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
clerk received call from SPD Office and advises the court Atty Parent was appointed in error. New counsel will be appointed on this case.

Defendant Monte Gregory Bush in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Monte Gregory Bush appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY. 
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation and has been in contact with SPD Office. Public Defender's Office has not appointed counsel. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.
  Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Monte Gregory Bush in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/25/22 @ 2p
